required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Roxadustat in the Treatment of Anemia in End Stage Renal Disease (ESRD) Patients on Stable Dialysis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Open-Label, Active-Controlled Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Roxadustat in the Maintenance Treatment of Anemia in End Stage Renal Disease Subjects on Stable Dialysis

brief_summary.textblock: This study is conducted to explore a new therapy for anemia in patients with end stage renal disease (ESRD) on dialysis. Anemia is a reduced number of red blood cells or hemoglobin. Hemoglobin (which contains iron) is important for the transport of oxygen in your blood. The purpose of this study is to evaluate if roxadustat is effective and safe in the maintenance treatment of anemia in ESRD patients on stable dialysis. Roxadustat will be compared to epoetin alfa and darbepoetin alfa, commercially available medicines for treatment of anemia.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study will consist of three study periods as follows:
- Screening Period: up to 6 weeks
- Treatment Period: a minimum of 52 weeks up to a maximum of 104 weeks
- Follow-up Period: 4 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: EU (European Medicines Agency): Hemoglobin (Hb) change from baseline to the average Hb of weeks 28 to 36 without having received rescue therapy
US (Food and Drug Administration): Hemoglobin (Hb) change from baseline to the average Hb of weeks 28 to 52, regardless of rescue therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Hb response without having received rescue therapy within 6 weeks prior to and during this 8-week evaluation period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 28 to 36

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Low Density Lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol to the average LDL cholesterol
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Weeks 12 to 28

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean monthly intravenous (IV) iron use (mg)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to Week 36

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood pressure effect: Change from baseline in mean arterial pressure (MAP) to the average MAP value
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Weeks 20 to 28

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood pressure effect: Time to an increase in blood pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 1 to 36

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in SF-36 Physical Functioning (PF) sub-score to the average PF sub-score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Weeks 12 to 28

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in SF-36 Vitality (VT) sub-score to the average VT sub-score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Weeks 12 to 28

secondary_outcome.measure: Hb response during weeks 28 and 36 regardless of use of rescue therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Hb change from baseline to each postdosing time point
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to End of Study (EOS) (Up to week 108)

secondary_outcome.measure: Hb level averaged over weeks 28 to 36, 44 to 52, and 96 to 104 without use of rescue therapy within 6 weeks prior to and during these 8-week evaluation periods
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Treatment (EOT) (Up to week 104)

secondary_outcome.measure: Hb change from baseline to the average Hb value of weeks 28 to 36, 44 to 52, and 96 to 104 regardless of the use of rescue therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to End of Treatment (EOT) (Up to week 104)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Hb values within 10.0 to 12.0 g/dL in weeks 28 to 36, 44 to 52, and 96 to 104 without use of rescue therapy within 6 weeks prior to and during these 8-week evaluation periods
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Treatment (EOT) (Up to week 104)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Treatment (EOT) (Up to week 104)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of days of hospitalization

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Treatment (EOT) (Up to week 104)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of RBC packs per subject
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Treatment (EOT) (Up to week 104)

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume of RBC transfused per subject
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Treatment (EOT) (Up to week 104)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants having received IV iron supplementation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Treatment (EOT) (Up to week 104)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean monthly IV iron (mg) per subject during weeks 37-52 and weeks 53-104
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Treatment (EOT) (Up to week 104)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants having required oral iron supplementation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Treatment (EOT) (Up to week 104)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean monthly oral iron (mg) use per subject during day 1 to week 36, weeks 37 to 52, and weeks 53-104
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Treatment (EOT) (Up to week 104)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to each postdosing study visit in Total cholesterol
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to End of Study (EOS) (Up to week 108)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to each postdosing study visit in LDL/High-density Lipoprotein (HDL) ratio
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to End of Study (EOS) (Up to week 108)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to each postdosing study visit in Non-HDL cholesterol
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to End of Study (EOS) (Up to week 108

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to each postdosing study visit in Apolipoproteins A1 and B
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to End of Study (EOS) (Up to week 108)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to each postdosing study visit in ApoB/ApoA1 ratio
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to End of Study (EOS) (Up to week 108)

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of mean LDL cholesterol <100 mg/dL calculated over weeks 12 to 28
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to week 28

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of achieved antihypertensive treatment goal in Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) subjects (Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) < 140 mmHg and Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) < 90 mmHg)based on the mean SBP and mean DBP calculated over weeks 12 to 28
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to week 28

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to the average value of weeks 12 to 28 in Short Form 36 (SF-36) Physical Component Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and weeks 12 to 28

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to the average value of weeks 12 to 28 in Anemia Subscale ("Additional Concerns") of Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Anemia (FACT-An) Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and weeks 12 to 28

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to the average value of weeks 12 to 28 in Total FACT-An Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and weeks 12 to 28

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to the average value of weeks 12 to 28 in European Quality of Life 5 Domain 5 Level (EQ-5D 5L) visual analogue scale (VAS) Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and weeks 12 to 28

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients' Global Impression of Change (PGIC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Treatment (EOT) (Up to week 104)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline to each study visit in Serum hepcidin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Study (EOS) (Up to week 108)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline to each study visit in Serum ferritin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Study (EOS) (Up to week 108)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline to each study visit in Transferrin Saturation (TSAT)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Study (EOS) (Up to week 108)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline to each study visit in Glycated hemoglobin (HbA1c) level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Study (EOS) (Up to week 108)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by occurrence of Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Study (EOS) (Up to week 108)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by occurrence of Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Study (EOS) (Up to week 108)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by occurrence of Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Study (EOS) (Up to week 108)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by occurrence of Treatment Emergent Serious Adverse Events (TESAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Study (EOS) (Up to week 108)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with vital signs abnormalities and/or adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Study (EOS) (Up to week 108)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by 12- lead electrocardiogram (ECG)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Treatment (EOT) (Up to week 104)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with clinically significant laboratory value abnormalities and/or adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Study (EOS) (Up to week 108)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety as assessed by occurrence of prespecified adjudicated cardiovascular events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Study (EOS) (Up to week 108)
secondary_outcome.description: Major cardiovascular adverse events: myocardial infarction, death from all causes, chronic heart failure requiring hospitalization, unstable angina requiring hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety as assessed by time to occurrence of prespecified adjudicated cardiovascular events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Study (EOS) (Up to week 108)
secondary_outcome.description: Major cardiovascular adverse events: myocardial infarction, death from all causes, chronic heart failure requiring hospitalization, unstable angina requiring hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety as assessed by occurrence of prespecified adjudicated cerebrovascular events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Study (EOS) (Up to week 108)
secondary_outcome.description: Stroke or death from all causes

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety as assessed by time to occurrence of prespecified adjudicated cerebrovascular events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Study (EOS) (Up to week 108)
secondary_outcome.description: Stroke or death from all causes

arm_group.description: Dose adjustments are allowed during the study.
Treatment administered can be epoetin alfa or darbepoetin alfa. Dose adjustments are allowed during the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Main Inclusion:
- Subject is on stable hemodialysis (HD), hemodiafiltration (HDF) or peritoneal dialysis (PD) treatment with the same mode of dialysis for ≥4 months prior to randomization.
- Subject is on IV or SC epoetin or IV or SC darbepoetin alfa treatment for ≥8 weeks prior to randomization with stable weekly doses (during 4 weeks prior to randomization).
- Mean of the subject's three most recent Hb values, as measured by central laboratory, during the Screening Period.
- Subject's alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and aspartate aminotransferase (AST) are ≤3 x upper limit of normal (ULN), and total bilirubin (TBL) is ≤1.5 x ULN.
Exclusion Criteria:
Main Exclusion:
- Subject has received a red blood cell (RBC) transfusion within 8 weeks prior to randomization.
- Subject has a known hereditary hematologic disease such as thalassemia or sickle cell anemia, pure red cell aplasia, or other known causes for anemia other than Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD).
- Subject has had a myocardial infarction, acute coronary syndrome, stroke, seizure, or a thrombotic/thrombo-embolic event (e.g., deep vein thrombosis or pulmonary embolism) within 12 weeks prior to randomization.
- Subject has had uncontrolled hypertension, in the opinion of the investigator, within 2 weeks prior to randomization.
- Subject has a history of malignancy, except for the following: cancers determined to be cured or in remission for ≥5 years, curatively resected basal cell or squamous cell skin cancers, cervical cancer in situ, or resected colonic polyps.
- Subject has had any prior organ transplant (that has not been explanted), or subject is scheduled for organ transplantation.
